result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jagger X Koeser

records.addlTxt:
8:59 AM Defendant Jagger X Koeser in court.  Attorney Harry R Hertel in court for Jagger X Koeser.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 as charged: Terrorist Threats. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea. Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea filed with and accepted by the Court. 24 hours of community service included as part of the DAGP.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 19, 2024 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on March 19, 2024 at 09:30 am.
Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement (DAGP) - Signed
Same as Complaint.
Plea hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:56 AM Defendant Jagger X Koeser in court.  Attorney Harry R Hertel in court for Jagger X Koeser.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement to a felony DAGP. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Not guilty pleas also entered on all counts in this case.
Case referred to Br. 5 for a plea hearing.
